solution.text:
Since Rs. _{{100*j}}_ is the profit on bat one.
Hence, profit percentage = (_{{100*j}}_/_{{1000*j}}_) x 100 = 10%
loss percentage = profit percentage - 5 = 10-5 = 5%
So, Loss = (loss percentage x cost price) /100 = (5 x _{{1000*j}}_)/100 = Rs. _{{50*j}}_
\( \Rightarrow \) Therefore, Selling price of bat 2 = Original price - loss = _{{1000*j}}_ - _{{50*j}}_ = Rs. _{{950*j}}_

content.text: Assuming each bat costs Rs _{{j*1000}}_. If the profit percentage on the first sale is 5%more than the loss percentage on the second sale, and if the profit on bat one is Rs. _{{j*100}}_. What was the price that bat 2(the one which had loss) was sold at?
